playbook_techno_drawback_description_0: You take +1 heat the first time you use emergent power of any kind on a run. Yes: even Attuning counts as emergent power.
playbook_techno_drawback_description_1: Your methods rely on an antiquated understanding of technology. You suffer reduced effect when you use high technology without your powers.
playbook_techno_drawback_description_2: Each downtime phase, you must spend one downtime activity studying and practicing in a lodge (or else lose 1 edge).
playbook_techno_drawback_description_3: 6-clock, Accosted by OTF agents, 1 tick per use of a secret art. This is a supernatural consequence which you may roll to resist as usual.
playbook_techno_method_description_0: The control of signals using the spaces between them. You may roll to resist supernatural consequences with Intuition. Also take one drawback.
playbook_techno_method_description_1: The control of signals with machine languages you can speak. When you make a deal with an emergent entity, you get +1d. Also take one drawback.
playbook_techno_method_description_2: You gain the benefits of both methods above. Also take two drawbacks.
playbook_techno_method_description_3: You completely deny the benefits and trappings of emergent tradition. To what can you attribute your power: faith, insanity, or some other delusion? Take zero drawbacks.
playbook_techno_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with knowledge or emergent power.
playbook_trigger_xp_condition: You addressed a challenge with tracking or violence.
pointed_ears_desc: You can hear sound from further away. Spend 1 edge to perceive beyond normal limits for several minutes. Understand subsonic speech, perceive ultrasonic vibrations, hear a pin drop in a noisy room, etc.
prehensile_tail_desc: You have a tail which you might use to hold or grab things
privilege_desc: When using the magical lineages option, all other magical lineages are the minorities, resulting in preferential treatment from fellow humans. Instead of writing any traits, you may choose up to two free permutations during character creation to represent your easier life (without the accompanying negative permutations).
prodigy_desc: Take a third action dot (counts as two)
prowl_description: Prowl about unseen and traverse obstacles; climb, swim, run, jump, and tumble. Ambush with close violence — a backstab, throat cutting, black-jack, etc.
query_for_consequence: Query for consequence name when resisting
quick_desc: You remain fast at normal loadout.
ratkindesc: Ratkin are genetic hybrids with human builds, whiskers, furry little rat ears, and a wiggly tail.
rat_senses_desc: You can detect sound and scent from further away than normal. Cheese forces you to salivate from far away too.
reagents_description: Arcane or emergent reagents (choose one) that contain some concentrated essence. Rendered inert and dissipate upon consumption by a mage or techno.
recoveryblurb: Get treatment in downtime to activate your healing project clock
resist_instructions: Suffer 6 stress minus the highest die result. When you roll a critical on resistance, clear 1 stress.
senses_info: Choose which set(s) of organs and up to 2 features
shell_viceblurb: Your cybernetic body runs on electricity. Recharge your capacitors by connecting to an industrial-grade conduit (downtime activity). When you do this, regain 5 energy.
shifterdesc: Shifters can change their shape with a bit of effort, allowing them to take on another mammalian beast form.
show_broadcast: Show broadcast buttons for sending information to chat
show_cohort_section: Show cohort field on character sheet
show_outline: Show outline for active input fields
small_frames: An aquaspy, a rotodrone, a cybernetic doll, wasp.
stalk_description: Stalk a target; gather information about its location and movements; attack with precision shooting from a distance.
stoneskin_desc: You have a measure of protection against piercing and slashing damage. You can't move quickly—and you have to hide your skin to be inconspicuous (even with a light loadout).
study_description: Study a person, document, or item with close scrutiny to gather information and apply knowledge; gain a deeper understanding; do research.
subterfuge_supplies_description: A theatrical makeup kit and costume jewelry. A subvocal communicator and a contact lens with built-in ocular overlay. A janitor outfit and a trashy cover story. A database of blank license templates, ready for the forger's hand. A reversible trenchcoat and distinctive hat. A vial of concentrated pheromones. A common skillchip. A tag eraser. A clandestine surveillance kit.
survey_description: Survey a location or situation to understand what's going on; sense trouble before it happens; gather information about opportunities or exploits.
swap: You may swap out your available features as a downtime activity.
technical_tools_description: A basic set of tools for detailed mechanical or electrical work: soldering iron, spools of wire, small hammer, pliers, precision screwdrivers & wrenches, a small case containing assorted fasteners, etc.
tenacious_desc: You don't suffer from a harm penalty until you fill the entire row. Normally you suffer a penalty if any or all boxes in a given row of harm are filled.
thermal_senses_desc: Your senses can detect nearby thermal radiation signatures which are normally invisible.
thiccblood_desc: You don't suffer from the lingering effects of alcohol. You can choose to spend only 1 edge when you resist a consequence of poison or disease, regardless of the result of your roll.
touched_desc: Choose another spell, formula, or plan, already learned
tradition_features_info: Ancient — Cryptic — Doomsday — Enlightening — Insect — Maddening — Personality — Toxic
troll_armor_desc: Your skin and bones are hardened and your kind tend to get a thrill out of enduring (rather than avoiding) pain. You have an extra armor box available to you (draw it on your sheet), and get +1d when you make a resistance roll with Body.
trolldesc: Trolls are roughly half a meter taller than humans (or about seven feet) tall. They tend to have sharp personalities and dull wits by choice.
upgrade_added_site_description: You gain a hidden site in the city. When you take this upgrade, work with your GM to describe the new location and which fixers helped you get it. This upgrade requires Tier I and may be taken a number of times (in sum) equal to your crew's Tier +1, each time choosing describing a new location for a site. If the new site location is in a new district, the GM should tell you who controls it and then you decide how to deal with them.
upgrade_boathouse_description: The site has a boat, a dock on a waterway, and a small shed to store boating supplies. A second upgrade improves the boat with armor and more cargo capacity.
upgrade_body_description: Earn 2 xp when training body during downtime.
upgrade_boltholes_description: You have effective locations to lay low between operations. When you reduce heat, you can spend nuyen or rep 1-for-1 to the add to the final number of heat reduced by the result of your roll (this can reduce more than 5 heat). When you roll entanglements, choose one: treat your current heat level as one lower—the GM rolls your wanted level at -1d.
upgrade_cleanroom_description: The site has a work area and tools for bioengineering and cybernetics, designed to maintain strict limits on signals, temperature, humidity, and contaminants. You may accomplish long-term projects and perform surgery with these assets without leaving the site.
upgrade_cryptovault_description: You have an array of money laundering devices, increasing your storage capacity for nuyen to 8. A second upgrade increases your capacity for nuyen to 16. A separate area can be used as a signal-blocking containment area (choose one site).
upgrade_expansion_description: You have expanded your criminal operation to a new hidden site in a different city. You may spend upgrades for sites in your expansion city, and may accomplish long-term projects with these assets without leaving your headquarters. This upgrade requires the Headquarters upgrade, Tier II, and costs 4 upgrades to unlock. This upgrade can be taken a number of times (in sum) equal to the crew's current Tier, each time selecting a new city.
upgrade_garage_description: The site has a utility van, hydrogen condenser station, and a garage. A second upgrade improves the van with armor and a larger, faster engine. Flying vehicles are expensive. Combustion engines and petroleum fuels are novelty items—most vehicles in the city combine compressed gases to produce electricity as their means of propulsion.
upgrade_gear_description: +1 quality for Burglary Gear and Climbing Gear.
upgrade_headquarters_description: You are an established syndicate with a central base surrounded by expansive grounds. Your safehouse now serves as a headquarters site which can no longer be hidden. In addition, you may pursue projects using any site's asset without leaving your headquarters. A faction controls the area (the GM will tell you who)—when your status is positive with them, you may choose to lose 1 status with them or spend nuyen equal to your current wanted level +1 to make an entanglement involving lower-Tier authorities simply go away. This upgrade requires Tier I and costs 2 upgrade boxes to unlock.
upgrade_intuition_description: Earn 2 xp when training intuition during downtime.
upgrade_landing_pad_description: You have a long-range vehicle capable of vertical takeoff and landing, suitable for carrying a dozen people comfortably, outfitted with a retractable turret on the nose and tail. Your headquarters also features a landing pad and a hangar with added storage for flight supplies. Taking this upgrade requires the Headquarters upgrade and costs 2 upgrade boxes to unlock. A third upgrade improves the aircraft with your choice of two added features: armor—faster engines—more cargo capacity—stealth.
upgrade_lodge_description: A supernatural workshop devoted to a particular arcane or emergent method (choose which one when you gain this upgrade), with tools and materials for learning spells and performing binding ceremonies, as well as protective wards from supernatural interference and surveillance. You may accomplish long-term projects with these assets without leaving the site.
upgrade_mastery_description: Your crew has access to master level training. You may advance your PCs' action ratings to 4 (until you unlock this upgrade, PC action ratings are capped at 3). This costs four upgrade boxes to unlock.
upgrade_personal_description: Earn 2 xp when training playbook during downtime.
upgrade_quarters_description: You have a shared living quarters for the crew in this site. Without this upgrade, each PC sleeps elsewhere, and is vulnerable when they do so.
upgrade_secure_description: Your safehouse has locks, alarms, and traps to thwart intruders. A second upgrade improves the defenses to include arcane measures that work against spirits. You might roll your crew's Tier if these measures are ever put to the test, to see how well they thwart an intruder.
upgrade_tacnet_description: You have a passenger vehicle stocked with an array of communications and surveillance technology that shields it from counter-surveillance. Further, any crew members in the same district as your TacNet may perform teamwork maneuvers, regardless of the distance separating them. You might roll your crew's Tier if these measures are ever put to the test, to see how well they thwart counter-surveillance. You can move your TacNet between districts freely during downtime.
upgrade_tools_description: +1 quality for Demolition Tools and Interfacing Tools.
upgrade_vault_description: Your safehouse has a secure vault, increasing your storage capacity for nuyen to 8. A second upgrade increases your capacity to 16. A separate part of your vault can be used as a holding cell.
upgrade_willpower_description: Earn 2 xp when training willpower during downtime.
upgrade_workshop_description: The site has a work area with tools for electronics and chemicals, as well as a database of schematics and maps. You may accomplish long-term projects with these assets without leaving the site.
upgrade_workstation_description: The site has a work area with tools for software development and high-technology research, as well as a database of cutting-edge algorithms and scientific theories. You may accomplish long-term projects with these assets without leaving the site.
upon_crew_advance: Upon crew advance, each PC gets Stash = Tier+2
use_kirsty: Use Kirsty font if installed (only check if you have Kirsty)
vehicle_edges_flaws:
Vehicle Edges
Nimble: The vehicle handles easily. Consider this an assist for tricky maneuvers.
Simple: The vehicle is easy to repair. Remove all of its harm during downtime.
Sturdy: The vehicle keeps operating even when broken.

Vehicle Flaws
Costly: Thee vehicle costs 1 nuyen per downtime to keep in operation.
Distinct: Thee vehicle has memorable features. Take +1 heat when you use it on a score.
Finicky: The vehicle has quirks that only one person understands. When operated without them, the vehicle has -1 quality.
vice_info: Deviant — Faith — Gambling — Luxury — Obligation — Pleasure — Stupor
vice_instructions: Clear an amount of stress equal to the highest die result. If the result of your vice roll means you clear more stress levels than you had marked, you overindulge.
wallclimb_desc: Your hands stick to flat surfaces and climb sheer walls easily.
warblurb1: When you're marked by any number of factions (status -3), the following penalties apply:
warblurb2: Lose 1 hold (temporarily, while you continue to be marked). This may knock you down a Tier.
warblurb3: PCs get only one free downtime action instead of two.
warblurb5: Your claims which generate nuyen (vice dens, gambling rings, fences, etc.) produce only half their normal income (round down).
willpower_description: Resist consequences from mental strain or resolve.
winged_desc: You can fly quickly up to a few meters above the ground in short bursts using wings powered by supernatural lift. If your wings are damaged, they will slowly grow back (quickly while resting). If you wings are utterly destroyed, you lose this trait.
wreck_description: Wreck a place, item, or obstacle with savage force or carefully applied sabotage; breach defenses with force; create distractions and chaos.
xp_beliefs: You expressed your beliefs, drives, heritage, or background.
xp_bolster: Bolster your crew's reputation or develop a new one.
xp_contend: Contend with challenges above your current station.
xp_crew_specific: Enter your crew's specific way to mark karma here.
xp_desperate: Every time you roll a desperate action, mark karma in that action's attribute.
xp_express: Express the goals, drives, inner conflict, or essential nature of the crew.
xp_specific: Enter your playbook's specific way to mark karma here.
xp_specific_extra: Enter another specific way to mark karma here.
xp_top: At the end of each session, for each item below, mark 1 karma (or instead mark 2 karma if that item occurred multiple times).
xp_vice: You struggled with issues from your vice or traumas during the session.
zerodice: Zero Dice — take the lowest result above
